title: 6.20 Lag spikes, Ping is fine.
body:
From patch 6.20 , i`ve experienced a huuuuge lag spike. The ping is fine 40-45 ms. I cannot move or cast a spell from the champion i selected for 2-3 seconds, after , it`s normal, then again, 2-3 seconds cannot cast or move. It`s quite difficult to play a game, when you are toplaner or jungler (or everylane), cause in this time , you can kill or be killed.  I`ve searched for previous fixes to this problem, none worked. Please, a solution or a half of solution would be fine.

Ty kindly.

replies.body:
This definitely sounds like bursts of packet loss that you're experiencing. I strongly recommend ensuring your local network settings are compatible with League using our [connection troubleshooting guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

If you continue to have problems after working through those steps, let me know and we can take a look at your route to the server.

I'm having the same problems as brightside. When I look at the "ping" text after I run the test I should be having no problems because I have an average ms of 36 and 4 packets received after 4 packets were sent. Any help would be greatly appreciated...

If you're testing your latency using a trace command in Command Prompt, it likely isn't tracing to our test servers.

I recommend taking the same steps I listed above in the connection guide as a first step before looking into your route.
I have same issue on EUW! Riot help pls?

Okay, so my ping is all over the place. It goes from 30-ish all the way to 3-4 thousand in a matter of seconds. I have tried this on multiple computers on multiple networks, so it can't be because of my network. And I can't even do anything because every few seconds I get the "Attempting to Reconnect" sign. I also have been getting hit with the leaver penalty over and over again. I can't even play the game. After all the money I put into this game, why are there so many issues...? Can I report Riot after game for latency issues?
